definition: to flip out/to act out violently
to send out/to show (one's feeling)/to issue/to develop/to make a bundle of money/classifier for gunshots (rounds)

sentences.english: My sister was horrified to find me trespassing on her side of the bedroom.
sentences.chinese: 妹妹看到我如此糟蹋她的牀，發飆了。

sentences.english: We'll have the hags flung out.
sentences.chinese: 這裏將會有女巫突然發飆。

sentences.english: This will be your last outburst.
sentences.chinese: 這將是你最後一次發飆了。

sentences.english: But he should not be no reason to me Stories behind Olympic.
sentences.chinese: 但他也不應該平白無故地向我發飆。

sentences.english: My wife forgets to say hello, and I blow up.
sentences.chinese: 妻子忘記打招呼，我就發飆。

sentences.english: This will be your last outburst,officer.
sentences.chinese: 這將是你最後一次發飆了，長官。

sentences.english: We can't get mad and walk to another room.
sentences.chinese: 我們不會發飆，躲進別的房間。

definition: to catch fire/to ignite/to detonate/to get angry
to seethe/to sulk/to be pissed off (vulgar)
to rain curses (on sb)/to let sb have it/to bawl sb out
to be made to stand still as a punishment
no cause, no reason (idiom); completely uncalled for
to swear or curse (at people)/to scold or yell at someone
to be in a bad mood
lit. wading in mud and water/a slovenly job/sloppy
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
to hurl abuse/to trade insults/slanging match
to make trouble without reason (idiom); to be deliberately provocative
the cool eye of a bystander/a detached point of view
to stomp or hop about (in anxiety, anger etc)/to dance on one's feet/hopping mad (anxious, etc)
to act in a fit of pique/to get in a huff/to be peeved
